abstract.p: Eric Mower & Associates acquires Sage Macrom; US operations of Publicis Groupe is acquiring Fusion DM advertising agency from MarketFirst Software (S)

block.p: Two acquisitions are being made for undisclosed terms.

Eric Mower & Associates in Syracuse acquired Sage Marcom in Syracuse, which specializes in business-to-business advertising. The combined agency, operating under the Mower name, will have more than 200 employees and billings estimated at more than $150 million from clients like Carrier and Eastman Kodak.
Two acquisitions are being made for undisclosed terms.

Eric Mower & Associates in Syracuse acquired Sage Marcom in Syracuse, which specializes in business-to-business advertising. The combined agency, operating under the Mower name, will have more than 200 employees and billings estimated at more than $150 million from clients like Carrier and Eastman Kodak.

Eric Mower, 56, chairman and chief executive at Mower, retains those posts at the combined agency and John Favalo, 55, president at Sage, becomes a managing partner. The combined agency also has offices in Albany; Atlanta; Buffalo; Portsmouth, N.H.; and Rochester.

The other acquisition, by the United States operations of the Publicis Groupe, is of Fusion DM in San Francisco, an interactive and direct response agency, which is being bought from MarketFirst Software in Mountain View, Calif. Fusion DM will be merged with the San Francisco office of a Publicis unit named Publicis Dialog, to form an agency with 110 employees and billings estimated at $140 million from clients like Hewlett-Packard.
